job_description:
Business Development Executive

Company: 2Base Technologies

We are seeking a high-performing, self-driven Senior Business Development Executive to join our team. This role involves generating leads, building client relationships, and driving revenue through IT services and digital solutions. The position requires end-to-end ownership of the sales process, from prospecting to closure.

Responsibilities - Identify and generate qualified leads via outbound channels, referrals, and market research. - Drive new business opportunities for web, mobile, and enterprise software development services. - Manage the full sales cycle: lead qualification, client communication, requirement analysis, proposal preparation, pricing, negotiation, and closure. - Propose tailored IT and digital transformation solutions aligned with client business objectives. - Build relationships with key decision-makers (Founders, CXOs, Product Owners). - Collaborate with delivery, design, and marketing teams to create compelling proposals. - Maintain CRM records and provide sales forecasts/reports. - Represent the company at networking events and client meetings. - Meet/exceed monthly/quarterly revenue targets.

Requirements - Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in education/experience. - 2-5 years of B2B sales experience in IT services/digital solutions. - Proven ability to manage sales pipelines and close deals independently. - Strong knowledge of software development services (web, mobile, SaaS, enterprise). - Experience with international clients preferred. - Familiarity with CRM systems (Zoho, HubSpot, Salesforce) and outbound tools (LinkedIn Sales Navigator). - Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills. - Ability to work autonomously and own sales targets. - Strategic thinking to address client pain points and position solutions.

Experience & Education - 2-5 years in sales/business development. - Bachelor’s/BSc. IT/CS/BCA/B-Tech/CS/EC/MBA/Diploma in CS/IT. - Certifications in sales, digital marketing, or business consulting are a plus.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.

job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience: - 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles - Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation - Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control - Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly - Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes - Experience with project management systems and documentation tools - Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel - Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications: - Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Translates business requirements into structured documentation, ensuring clarity and traceability across development. Collaborates with stakeholders to maintain accurate, up-to-date artifacts for QA, UAT, and audits.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role, not a screen updater role, and not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modeling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviors, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviors, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field.
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst.
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments.
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems.
  • Ability to run independent client workshops.
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle.

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst role at 2Base focuses on functional modeling, requirement clarity, and cross-team alignment. Owns end-to-end requirements for scalable product environments.

job_description:
Sr. DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture across engineering teams, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures across AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes using enforced security baselines.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and applications.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms with a focus on secure architecture.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code using Terraform, Ansible, or similar tools.
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Strong understanding of networking technologies (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers).
  • Knowledge of security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Experience with monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM).
  • Scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills to influence engineering teams.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior DevSecOps Engineer leads secure infrastructure automation and cloud security. Requires 4–8 years of experience with Terraform, Ansible, and cloud platforms.

job_description:
L2 SOC Security Analyst

Location: From Kochi Office (Onsite) Office: ART Technologies and Software

Job Summary

The L2 Security Analyst is responsible for performing advanced incident analysis, investigating security escalations from L1 analysts, conducting vulnerability assessments, and actively supporting threat hunting and malware analysis. This role acts as a critical link within the SOC by coordinating incident response efforts, ensuring compliance with security frameworks, and enhancing the organization's cybersecurity posture through diligent monitoring and remediation activities.

Key Responsibilities

  • Monitor, analyze, and respond to alerts generated by firewalls, proxy servers, and intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS).
  • Perform rule tuning and assist in configuration adjustments of firewall, proxy, and IDS devices.
  • Handle escalations from L1 analysts and conduct in-depth investigations of security incidents and alerts.
  • Perform comprehensive log analysis, root cause analysis, threat hunting, and forensic examinations.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders across IT, security, and business units to implement incident response and remediation.
  • Execute vulnerability assessments using tools like Nessus and Qualys; manage patching activities in coordination with relevant teams.
  • Participate in continuous threat hunting exercises and malware analysis to identify emerging threats.
  • Ensure adherence to security policies, standards, and regulatory frameworks such as ISO 27001, PCI DSS, and GDPR.
  • Maintain and update incident response playbooks; contribute to SOC process improvements.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentoring to L1 analysts.
  • Prepare detailed incident reports and documentation for stakeholders.

Required Experience and Qualifications

About Lean Transition Solutions (LTS)

LTS is a global Operational Excellence and Lean Industry 4.0 software company headquartered in the UK. For over a decade, we’ve helped large organizations turn strategy into action by combining Lean thinking, leadership principles, and modern, scalable technology. We are proud to be trusted by leading global organizations, supporting them in building sustainable, people-centric transformation at scale.

With teams across India, Europe, the US, the Middle East, and Mexico, we operate as one connected global team. At LTS, we believe technology strengthens people, enabling them to do their best work. That belief shapes our products, our culture, and how we work together.

Location: Technopark Phase 1, Trivandrum

Role Overview

We’re seeking a QA Lead to oversee quality assurance across our software products. You’ll lead junior QA engineers, own all test planning and execution, implement modern test automation practices, and work closely with stakeholders to ensure top-notch delivery quality.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead and mentor junior QA engineers, providing guidance and skill development
  • Communicate testing status and quality metrics to technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Design and implement QA strategy, test plans, and quality standards
  • Build and maintain automated testing frameworks using Playwright, Cypress, or similar tools
  • Collaborate with Product, Development, and Project Management teams on release planning
  • Track quality metrics and drive continuous improvement initiatives

Required Qualifications

  • 4+ years of QA experience with 1+ years in a lead/senior role
  • Proven experience leading and mentoring QA team members
  • Hands-on expertise with modern automation tools (Playwright or Cypress or Selenium)
  • Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript for test automation
  • Knowledge of CI/CD tools and processes for integrating test automation pipelines
  • Excellent communication skills with ability to engage technical and business stakeholders
  • Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and software development lifecycle
  • Self-motivated with analytical problem-solving abilities

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in SaaS or B2B software environments
  • Background in manufacturing or industrial software
  • API and performance testing experience

Why You’ll Love Working With Us

Meaningful Work with Global Impact

Contribute to enterprise platforms used by world-class organizations such as Philips, Hitachi, Pfizer, and other global leaders—helping them improve how they operate, lead, and grow.

People-First, Collaborative Culture

Your ideas are heard, your work is valued, and you’re supported by a team built on trust and respect.

Purpose-Driven Technology

Build practical, thoughtful products that solve real operational and leadership challenges.

Growth & Ownership

Learn continuously, take ownership of your work, and grow your career in a supportive environment.

Global Exposure, Human Connection

Work with diverse teams and enterprise clients worldwide—while feeling connected and supported.

Quality, Security & Trust

Our platforms and processes are backed by internationally recognized ISO certifications, reflecting our strong commitment to quality, data security, and operational reliability. This means you work in an environment built on high standards and trust.

Build a Strong Future Together

At LTS, we don’t just deliver solutions—we build long-term relationships. Together, we create a strong, sustainable future for our people, our clients, and our organization. From continuous learning and career development opportunities to meaningful ownership in your work, we support you at every stage of your journey. Our people benefit from a supportive work environment, competitive benefits, and a culture that values balance, trust, and long-term success.
